actor_awards.notes: A legendary director and screenwriter who also had a distinguished acting career. He won Academy Awards for Directing and Screenplay for 'The Treasure of the Sierra Madre'. He was nominated for Best Supporting Actor for 'The Cardinal' (1963). His final lead performance in Orson Welles' 'The Other Side of the Wind' was released posthumously in 2018.

filmography.title: Chinatown
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, corrupt, and incestuous land baron who controls the water supply of Los Angeles.
filmography.plot: A private detective hired to expose an adulterer finds himself caught up in a web of deceit, corruption, and murder.

filmography.title: The Treasure of the Sierra Madre
filmography.role_description: An uncredited cameo as a wealthy tourist in the White Suit who is pestered by Bogart's character for money.
filmography.plot: Two down-on-their-luck Americans searching for work in 1920s Mexico convince an old prospector to help them mine for gold in the Sierra Madre Mountains.

filmography.title: The Cardinal
filmography.role_description: A powerful and imposing Prince of the Church who mentors a young priest.
filmography.plot: An American priest of Irish descent rises through the church hierarchy to become a Cardinal, facing various social and personal challenges along the way.

filmography.title: The Bible: In the Beginning...
filmography.role_description: Huston directed and played the role of the ark-builder Noah, as well as providing the voice of the Creator.
filmography.plot: Extravagant production of the first part of the book of Genesis, covering Adam and Eve, Noah, and Abraham.

filmography.title: Winter Kills
filmography.role_description: A powerful, corrupt patriarch inspired by Joseph Kennedy, who manipulates his son's investigation into a presidential assassination.
filmography.plot: The younger brother of an assassinated US President is led to a dying man who claims to be the assassin, sparking a new investigation.

filmography.title: The Wind and the Lion
filmography.role_description: The US Secretary of State under Theodore Roosevelt who manages the international crisis.
filmography.plot: In 1904, an American widow and her children are kidnapped by a Moroccan chieftain, prompting President Roosevelt to send in the troops.

filmography.title: Battle for the Planet of the Apes
filmography.role_description: The legendary orangutan prophet who narrates the story of Caesar to human and ape children.
filmography.plot: Ten years after conquering the Earth, ape leader Caesar wants the ruling apes and enslaved humans to live in peace, but warring factions threaten to tear the society apart.

filmography.title: Casino Royale
filmography.role_description: The head of MI6 who visits James Bond to persuade him to come out of retirement.
filmography.plot: In an early spy spoof, aging Sir James Bond comes out of retirement to take on SMERSH.

filmography.title: The Hobbit
filmography.role_description: The voice of the wise wizard who guides Bilbo Baggins on his adventure.
filmography.plot: A home-loving hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, is swept into a quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.

filmography.title: The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
filmography.role_description: The famous mountain man who gives Judge Roy Bean a bear.
filmography.plot: An outlaw establishes his own brand of law and order in a small town on the Pecos River.

filmography.title: Man in the Wilderness
filmography.role_description: The leader of a fur trapping expedition who abandons a wounded guide to die.
filmography.plot: A fur trapper is mauled by a bear and left for dead by his companions, but he survives and tracks them down.

filmography.title: Wise Blood
filmography.role_description: The fanatical preacher grandfather seen in flashbacks who haunts the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A man returns home to the South and decides to start his own church without Christ.

filmography.title: The Black Cauldron
filmography.role_description: The voice that introduces the dark fantasy world of Prydain.
filmography.plot: A young boy and a group of misfit friends embark on a quest to find a dark magic item of ultimate power before a diabolical tyrant can.

filmography.title: Tentacles
filmography.role_description: An intrepid journalist investigating mysterious deaths at sea caused by a giant octopus.
filmography.plot: A giant octopus terrorizes the California coast, and a reporter teams up with a marine expert to stop it.

filmography.title: The Visitor
filmography.role_description: An intergalactic warrior sent to Earth to save a young girl with telekinetic powers from evil forces.
filmography.plot: An intergalactic warrior arrives on Earth to protect a young girl with special powers from an evil cult.

filmography.title: Breakout
filmography.role_description: The corrupt grandfather who framed his own grandson to cover up illegal dealings.
filmography.plot: A bush pilot is hired to rescue a framed American businessman from a Mexican prison.

filmography.title: Sherlock Holmes in New York
filmography.role_description: The arch-nemesis of Sherlock Holmes who kidnaps the son of Irene Adler.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes travels to New York City to investigate a threat by Professor Moriarty and to help his old flame Irene Adler.

filmography.title: The Deserter
filmography.role_description: The commanding officer who offers a pardon to a deserter if he leads a special mission.
filmography.plot: A cavalry officer deserts the army after his wife is killed, but is brought back to lead a special forces mission against the Apache.

filmography.title: Candy
filmography.role_description: A bizarre hospital administrator in this psychedelic satire.
filmography.plot: A naive high school girl seeks meaning in life and encounters a series of colorful characters in her journeys.

filmography.title: Myra Breckinridge
filmography.role_description: A former cowboy star who runs an acting academy, becoming the target of Myra's schemes.
filmography.plot: Myron Breckinridge undergoes a sex-change operation and arrives in Hollywood as Myra to claim her inheritance and wreak havoc.

filmography.title: The Return of the King
filmography.role_description: The voice of the wizard Gandalf in this animated adaptation of Tolkien's work.
filmography.plot: Two hobbits struggle to destroy the Ring of Power at Mount Doom while their friends fight a desperate battle to distract the enemy.

filmography.title: A Minor Miracle
filmography.role_description: A priest who tries to save his orphanage by enlisting the help of soccer legend Pele.
filmography.plot: A priest recruits the legendary soccer player Pele to help save an orphanage.

filmography.title: Momo
filmography.role_description: The administrator of Time who helps the young girl Momo fight against the Grey Men.
filmography.plot: A young orphan girl fights against the Grey Men, who are stealing time from the people of her city.

filmography.title: Jaguar Lives!
filmography.role_description: A mysterious figure involved in the world of international espionage.
filmography.plot: A secret agent travels the globe to stop a drug cartel and battle various villains.

filmography.title: Lovesick
filmography.role_description: An established psychiatrist and mentor figure.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist falls in love with one of his patients, prompting the spirit of Sigmund Freud to appear and offer advice.

filmography.title: The Other Side of the Wind
filmography.role_description: A legendary, cynical Hollywood director attempting to make a comeback film. Filmed in the 1970s but released posthumously.
filmography.plot: A Hollywood director emerges from semi-exile to finish his comeback movie, but the production is plagued by chaos.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – William K. Everson Film History Award

filmography.title: De Sade
filmography.role_description: The uncle of the Marquis de Sade who tries to influence his nephew's life.
filmography.plot: A fictionalized biography of the Marquis de Sade, exploring his hedonistic lifestyle and imprisonment.
